title: RVT
explain:
Man-pack Remote Video Terminal

Man-pack Remote Video Terminal (RVT), acting as an optional and auxiliary ground equipment of UAV telemetry and telecontrol (TT&C) information transmission system, is used for receiving reconnaissance image from single UAV.
cont:
Main Functions

  • Receiving and displaying image from single UAV
  • Receiving and displaying telemetry parameters and flight path for single UAV
  • Data record and playback
Main Specifications
Operation frequencyL-band
Max Operation Distance50km
Antenna TypeOmni-directional antenna
Continuous Operational Time of Information Processing Computer4hours
Continuous Operational Time of Receiving Combination8hours
Power SupplyAccumulator
Total Weight7.5kg
Operating Temperature－20℃～+55℃
features:
Portable Remote Video Terminal

Remote Video Terminal (RVT) is mainly used for receiving telemetry and high-rate reconnaissance data for C-band downlink signal from single UAV within LOS range. And the main functions include receiving, processing and display of reconnaissance data, display of flight path, etc.

Main Functions

  • Receiving of telemetry data from single UAV
  • Receiving , displaying and recording reconnaissance data from single UAV
  • Displaying and recording telemetry parameter and flight path for single UAV
Main Specifications
Max Operation Distance50km
Antenna OperationAzimuth: automatic, manual, digital guidance
Elevation: mechanical manual
Antenna Coverage RangeAzimuth: ±360° continuous
Elevation: -3°～+65°
Transmission Rate2.048Mbps, 4.096Mbps, 8.192Mbps optional
Transmission BER≤10-5
Environmental TemperatureOperation temperature: －20℃～+55℃
Storage temperature: －40℃～+65℃

Equipment Composition

Portable RVT is portable receiving station, which can be backpacked by two soldiers, when antenna can be mounted on portable tripod, and ruggedized pad is used for information processing. Battery and charger is configured when battery is charged before mission and charger is not carried during mission.

Portable RVT

Interface

External interface is not available during mission. After mission, recorded telemetry and mission data can be outputted through the network port of the pad

Power Supply

Battery power supply is configured for receiving equipment, when self-equipped battery is configured for information processing pad.

Portability

Total weight of equipment is 25 kg. And the equipment can be carried by two soldiers, when one carries antenna and tripod, and the other carries receiving equipment, pad and battery, shown as following photos:

Vehicular Remote Video Terminal

Remote Video Terminal (RVT) is mainly used for receiving telemetry and high-rate reconnaissance data for C-band downlink signal from single UAV within LOS range. And the main functions include receiving, processing and display of reconnaissance data, display of flight path, etc.

Main Functions

  • Receiving of telemetry data from single UAV
  • Receiving, displaying and recording reconnaissance data (SAR image is not included) from single UAV
  • Displaying and recording telemetry parameter and flight path for single UAV
Main Specifications
Max Operation Distance120 km
Antenna OperationAzimuth: automatic, manual, digital guidance
Elevation:digital guidance, manual
Antenna Coverage RangeAzimuth: ±360° continuous
Elevation: -3°～+65°
Transmission Rate2.048Mbps, 4.096Mbps, 8.192Mbps optional
Transmission BER≤10-5
Environmental TemperatureOperation temperature: －20℃～+55℃
Storage temperature: －40℃～+65℃

Equipment Composition

Vehicular RVT is a vehicular station, when antenna and antenna pedestal are mounted on top of shelter, and equipment cabinet is installed inside shelter.

Interface

External interface is not available during mission. After mission, recorded telemetry and mission data can be outputted through the network port of the pad

Power Supply

Battery power supply is configured for receiving equipment, when self-equipped battery is configured for information processing pad.

Portability

Total weight of equipment is 25 kg. And the equipment can be carried by two soldiers, when one carries antenna and tripod, and the other carries receiving equipment, pad and battery, shown as following photos:
